item.description:
Winter in the Whites...and time for ice climbing.  Let's meet up at 9 at the Albany Covered Bridge Ice Flows (see The Ice Climber's Guide to Northern New England).  The Albany Covered Bridge is on Dugway/Passaconaway Road, just off of Route 112 NH (the Kangamangus), about 6.2 miles west from the intersection of 112 and Route 16 in Conway.  The climbing is through the bridge (closed to car traffic at this time of year), on the left-hand side of the Dugway/Passaconaway Road.  The plan is to do mostly top rope and lead climbing on 2-4's.

You must have mountaineering boots, crampons, harness, locking biner+belay device, helmet, balaclava, two or more pairs of gloves (they get wet), water proof (eg, Gore-Tex) tops and bottoms, warm fleece layers, and thermal wicking layer. If you have ice tools, ropes, biners, screws, anchor material, bring those too.

For more information, check out the FAQ's on ice climbing.

For weather, Accuweather, Mount Washington Observatory

Current ice climbing conditions: neice.com, neclimbs.com
item.name: Ice climbing in the Whites
